Q: A group of researchers conducted a study to investigate whether there is a causal relationship between eating chocolate and having acne. They recruited 100 participants, half of whom were randomly assigned to eat a chocolate bar every day for a month, while the other half were instructed not to eat any chocolate during that time. At the end of the month, the researchers counted the number of pimples on each participant's face. They found that the group who ate chocolate had, on average, slightly more pimples than the group who did not eat chocolate. Based on these results, can we conclude that eating chocolate causes acne?
